answerText: Nernst equation[10] Some variations of the Nernst equation, like the ButlerVolmer and Tafel equations, contain this term, symbolized nu. It is the difference between the derived half cell reduction potential and the observed reduction potential. This term arises because energy lost as heat makes reactions less efficient than calculations predict.
heading: Terrapin |2013 | Editors 1 - FINAL | 5 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One form of this equation states that E equals E nought minus RT over z F ln Q. For 10 points each: [10] Name this equation that can be used to determine the reduction potential in a half-cell or a voltage of the full cell.
